secure.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to get or achieve something that will be permanent, especially after a lot of effort
secure.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Boyd’s goal secured his team’s place in the Cup Final.
Negotiators are still working to secure the hostages’ release.
Redgrave won his third Olympic gold medal, and secured his place in history.
The company secured a $20 million contract.
secure.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make something safe from being attacked, harmed, or lost
secure.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Troops were sent to secure the border.
an agreement to secure the future of the rainforest
They built a ten-foot high fence to secure the house against intruders.
secure.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to fasten or tie something firmly in a particular position
secure.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: John secured the boat firmly to the jetty.
secure.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if you secure a debt or a loan, you legally promise that, if you cannot pay back the money you have borrowed, you will give the lender goods or property of the same value instead
secure.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: He used his house to secure the loan.
secure.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a situation that is secure is one that you can depend on because it is not likely to change
secure.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: There are no secure jobs these days.
We want a secure future for our children.
United’s position at the top of the league seems relatively secure.
secure.translation[1].definitions[1].def: locked or guarded so that people cannot get in or out or steal anything
secure.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The house isn’t very secure – we need some new locks.
Keep your passport in a secure place.
In the last year, only three children under the age of 14 have had to be placed in secure accommodation.
secure.translation[1].definitions[2].def: safe from and protected against damage or attack
secure.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Companies can offer secure credit card transactions over the Internet.
These elephants are relatively secure from poachers.
secure.translation[1].definitions[3].def: feeling confident about yourself and your abilities
secure.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: We want our children to be secure and feel good about themselves.
secure.translation[1].definitions[4].def: feeling confident and certain about a situation and not worried that it might change
secure.translation[1].definitions[4].exa: Workers no longer feel secure about the future.
It was enough money to make us feel financially secure.
We huddled together, secure in the knowledge that the rescue helicopter was on its way.
secure.translation[1].definitions[5].def: firmly fastened or tied, and not likely to fall down
secure.translation[1].definitions[5].exa: Are you sure that shelf is secure?
secure.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to get something you need after a lot of effort
secure.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The airline has secured financing of $150 million from private sponsors.
secure.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to promise a lender that they can take certain assets, such as property or shares, if their loan is not paid back within the agreed time limit
secure.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: Borrowers generally are required to secure a loan with personal property as collateral.
The debt is secured on some of the company’s assets.
secure.translation[3].definitions[0].def: investments or companies which are secure are not likely to lose money
secure.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Higher yields are considered to be less secure.
secure.translation[3].definitions[1].def: feeling confident about a particular situation, especially one which concerns the future
secure.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: The frequent announcements of staff cuts are making Americans feel less secure in their jobs.
secure.translation[3].definitions[2].def: safe and protected from damage, change, being stolen etc
secure.translation[3].definitions[2].exa: Customers want guarantees that cash machines will be secure from unauthorized use.
The single currency is giving industry more secure operating conditions.
